documentation.text:
Line describes a linear function, how the user's voice decreases from point (start, bias) with speed slope
 BrokenLine - a curve that describes the curve of the change in the sum of votes of several users
 This curve starts with a line (Line) and then, at any time, the slope can be changed.
 All slope changes are stored in slopeChanges. The slope can always be reduced only, it cannot increase,
 because users can only run out of lockup periods.*

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Slope > bias, unacceptable value for slope"

arguments.value: Slope > bias, unacceptable value for slope

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Slope > bias, unacceptable value for slope"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Line with given id is already exist"

arguments.value: Line with given id is already exist

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Line with given id is already exist"

documentation.text: @dev Remove Line from BrokenLine, return bias, slope, cliff. Run update BrokenLine.*

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "can't update BrokenLine for past time"

arguments.value: can't update BrokenLine for past time

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "can't update BrokenLine for past time"

documentation.text: @dev Update initial Line by parameter toTime. Calculate and set all changes*

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct LibBrokenLine.BrokenLine storage pointer,uint256,uint256,uint256) view returns (uint256)
function (struct LibBrokenLine.BrokenLine storage pointer,uint256,uint256,uint256) view returns (uint256)
